description: An industrial building originally built for maintaining railways with a modern rear extension now housing a modern glass processing company

factsheet.heading: History
paragraphs: There will be hourly tours of our factory production starting at 8.00A.M. with the last tour starting at 4.00P.M

Preedy Glass was formed in 1913 by Joseph Preedy, and is still a family business today run by the fourth generation of the Preedy family, having occupied the current premises in Park Royal since 1989.

factsheet.heading: Processing
paragraphs: Preedy Glass stock an extensive range of glass and mirror types, both traditional and modern and is renowned for its glass processing.

Using specialist machinery, our craftspeople can convert large sheets of 'raw' glass and mirror into top-quality finished products of different types and thicknesses. Our range of skills enables us to provide each of our residential or commercial customers with a bespoke solution to their requirements.

Assisting Interior Designers and Architects we work with a diverse clientele such as property developers, building contractors, luxury motor yacht manufacturers, exhibitors, conservators and private clients.

The finished end product of glass is typically used for frameless bespoke shower enclosures, painted glass splash backs, sliding glass doors, toughened glass assemblies, and glass floors and staircases, with mirrored walls a speciality, however every day creative designers come up with unique ways of using our bespoke products.
Our specialist glass and mirror products include the latest magnetic, decorative, switchable and TV glass solutions.
Craftspeople skills on display at the factory are glass cutting, edge polishing and bevelling including shaping, drilling, painting, toughening and UV bonding of glass.

Also at our premises, is our complementary glass related architectural ironmongery division covering all the accessories you need to install your glass meaning that Preedy offer a one stop complete service.

travel_info: Additional travel info: There are limited car parking spaces at the premises, but parking is available on Coronation Road

name: Preedy Glass
